intro: Lesquerella argentea var. arenosa, commonly known as silverleaf lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which helps it conserve water in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. Lesquerella argentea var. arenosa is known for its ability to thrive in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats.
